intro: Astracantha pachystachys, commonly known as the African daisy, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It features thick, fleshy leaves that are often covered in a whitish, powdery coating, which helps reduce water loss. The plant produces showy, daisy-like flowers in shades of yellow and orange, typically blooming in spring and summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value, it is widely cultivated in arid and semi-arid regions.
